comment.author: 43854658@N00
comment._content: Seven Dials "Seven dials is the name for a road junction and the immediate neighborhood surrounding it in the West End of London near Covent Garden. Here, seven streets converge at a roundabout, at the center of which is a pillar with six sundials. There are six dials because the original plan, designed by Thomas Neale [in 1690], only included the convergence of six streets." – more: Livablestreets .com
